claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: He's obviously had some academic training because he wrote this academic white paper that, you know, is in the style of a peer-reviewed academic journal article.
claims.speaker: Gavin Andresen

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: This sort of technology was developed independently a few times. I think the NSA developed it in the 70s and then academic cryptographers started putting this out later in the 90s.
claims.speaker: Peter Vessenes

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: When I first heard about Bitcoin, it seemed just like this very stupid magic internet money. I didn't really think it was very impressive at all.
claims.speaker: Erik Voorhees

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: Ask yourself which is more important in your life, money or email, and I think most people will say money. So this is bigger than email.
claims.speaker: Erik Voorhees

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: Bitcoin is cash for the internet. So it's a new kind of money and it's also a payment network that runs over the internet.
claims.speaker: Gavin Andresen

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: It's called public key cryptography. Now, we now rely on that technology every time your phone talks to your bank or even over maybe SMS sometimes.
claims.speaker: Peter Vessenes

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: As far as I know, no one has actually met Satoshi. No one knows who he or she or they are.
claims.speaker: Gavin Andresen

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: That's how we know there will only ever be 21 million Bitcoins created because if you do the math, that series works out to 21 million.
claims.speaker: Gavin Andresen

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: People with money tend to want to protect their money, and the biggest danger to many people's money is that the government will seize it.
claims.speaker: Erik Voorhees

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: I have the skills to actually go in and look at it and convince myself that technically, it was correct, that it could actually work.
claims.speaker: Gavin Andresen

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: I've never talked with Satoshi, although I have communicated with him electronically by email or on online forums.
claims.speaker: Gavin Andresen

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: I was skeptical at first, didn't think it could possibly work.
claims.speaker: Gavin Andresen

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: It was just an experiment to begin with, but I could see the potential with it.
claims.speaker: Peter Vessenes

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: Bitcoin is the most important invention at least since the internet.
claims.speaker: Erik Voorhees

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: It's just incredibly novel and interesting solution to problems.
claims.speaker: Peter Vessenes

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: There's a piece of digital information that you can hold that has value.
claims.speaker: Gavin Andresen

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: As long as nobody else knows that information, that value belongs to you.
claims.speaker: Gavin Andresen

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: Within a couple hours I became absolutely hooked.
claims.speaker: Erik Voorhees

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: It's a fundamental innovation.
claims.speaker: Peter Vessenes

claims.video_title: The Bitcoin Phenomenon
claims.claim_text: Bitcoin was invented by Satoshi Nakamoto.
claims.speaker: Gavin Andresen
